title: Student Attention Training During Experiments: Gaze-Tracking Feedback-Based Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of foundational math concepts and experimental observation experience
context.additional_context: Analysis of Real-Time Eye-Tracking Data and Math Experiment Video Viewing in a Digital Lab Environment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their own attention patterns with 80% accuracy using eye-tracking technology while watching experimental videos.
Learners can reduce the time spent searching for relevant information during experimental observations by over 30% based on feedback data.
Learners can interpret eye-tracking results to identify factors causing distraction and propose at least three improvement strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
